               Serendipity Point Films (2007). Length : 100min                


 The mysterious and charismatic Russian-born Nikolai Luzhin is a driver for   
 one of London&#039;s most notorious organized crime families of Eastern European  
 origin. The family itself is part of the Vory V Zakone criminal              
 brotherhood. Headed by Semyon, whose courtly charm as the welcoming          
 proprietor of the plush Trans-Siberian restaurant impeccably masks a cold    
 and brutal core, the family&#039;s fortunes are tested by Semyon&#039;s volatile son   
 and enforcer, Kirill, who is more tightly bound to Nikolai than to his own   
 father. But Nikolai&#039;s carefully maintained existence is jarred once he       
 crosses paths at Christmastime with Anna Khitrova, a midwife at a North      
 London hospital. Anna is deeply affected by the desperate situation of a     
 young teenager who dies while giving birth to a baby. Anna resolves to try   
 to trace the baby&#039;s lineage and relatives. The girl&#039;s personal diary also    
 survives her; it is written in Russian, and Anna seeks answers in it.        
 Anna&#039;s mother Helen does not discourage her, but Anna&#039;s irascible            
 Russian-born uncle Stepan urges caution. He is right to do so; by delving    
 into the diary, Anna has accidentally unleashed the full fury of the Vory.   
 With Semyon and Kirill closing ranks and Anna pressing her inquiries,        
 Nikolai unexpectedly finds his loyalties divided. The family tightens its    
 grip on him; who can, or should, he trust? Several lives - including his     
 own - hang in the balance as a harrowing chain of murder, deceit, and        
 retribution reverberates through the darkest corners of both the family and  
 London itself.
